patthana14.1:0.2_0: (The teachings should be expanded as in the previous discourse.)
patthana14.1:0.3_0: And he decorated the ten kinds of think:
patthana14.1:1.0_0: ‘ cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause reason cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause reason cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause the reason cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause the reason cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause the reason cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause the reason cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause cause
patthana14.1:1.1_0: Homage to that Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha!
patthana14.1:10.1_1: The nine streams of the mind; of the three, the nine, or three the five faculties.
patthana14.1:10.1_3: (This should be expanded in detail as in the previous discourse.)
patthana14.1:2.1_0: Because of his teaching doesn’t cause a reason to suffer under a false pretext—
patthana14.1:2.1_1: reflecting on the meaning of what has ended.
patthana14.1:2.1_2: There is no cause or condition for the reason.
patthana14.1:2.1_3: Because of causes and conditions for the sake of cause and reason.
patthana14.1:3.1_0: Not knowing and seeing the cause or condition for the reason.
patthana14.1:3.1_1: Not because of the teaching gives rise to causes and conditions.
patthana14.1:3.1_2: causes and reason for the sake of thought, not for the sake of cause or reason.
patthana14.1:4.1_0: Not knowing and seeing the cause or condition for the sake of causes.
patthana14.1:4.1_1: Not knowing and seeing the cause or condition for the reason.
patthana14.1:4.1_2: Not knowing and seeing causes and conditions for the sake of causes and conditions.
patthana14.1:5.1_0: Nine things, relying on letting go.
patthana14.1:5.1_2: (This should be told in full as in the previous discourse.)
patthana14.1:6.1_0: What is the cause, what is the reason why the three causes and conditions are fulfilled.
patthana14.1:7.1_0: for the sake of principle, not for the sake of support. ...
patthana14.1:8.1_0: for the sake of principle, not for the sake of a reason.
patthana14.1:9.1_0: What are the cause, what is the reason for the sake of listening to the teaching, for the sake of support, and for the sake of brief.
